en ORU Content Transfer \n Next Back Finish Exit Start over Content Transfer Content Transfer This application will help you copy your contacts, calendars and photos to another device.\n\nTouch the "Next" button to continue. Select Device \nSelect your other device from the list below.\n\nEnsure your other device is running the app and is connected to the same Wi-Fi network.\n" Confirm PIN \nFor security reasons you must enter the following PIN on your other device. Continue on your other device, until you are prompted to enter the PIN:\n Select content Contacts Calendars SMS Photos Videos Audio Apps Call Logs Settings Documents Transfer Time Copying Data \nPlease wait while your data is copied.\n Transfer Complete \nThe following data has been copied: It may take a while to detect your other device. Check that your other device is running the app and is connected to the same unrestricted Wi-Fi network. Connect to WiFi This device is not connected to a WiFi network. You must connect this device to a WiFi network before continuing. Searching for Devices Could Not Copy Data New device does not have enough storage. Unselect some content type on old device or free up some more space on new device and try again. Options \nYou have selected this device:\n \nSelect an option below depending on whether you want to copy data to or from the selected device:\n Copy data to selected device Copy data from selected device You can transfer your data wirelessly or you can backup and restore using Google Drive To or From Another Device Over a WiFi Network To or From Another Device Using WiFi Direct Back Up or Restore Content Back Up or Restore from SD Card Wirelessly Transfer Content Google Drive Options Select one of the following options to continue Back Up Data to Google Drive Restore Data from Google Drive SD Card Options Select one of the following options to continue: Back Up Data to SD Card Restore Data from SD Card Copy Failed It was not possible to copy all your data. Please check your internet connection and try again. \nSelect content to Transfer \nSelect content to Back Up \nSelect content to Restore Select the required data then touch "Next" to back it up to your account. Select the required data then touch "Next" to restore it to this device. No SD Card No SD card was detected. Ensure that a formatted SD card is inserted into this device and try again. Unable to Find Backup No backup was found on the SD card. Insufficient Space There is not enough space on the SD card to back up the selected data. Insufficient Space There is not enough space on Google Drive to back up the selected data. Already Exists A backup already exists on this SD card. Delete the old backup and then try again. If doing a full content transfer, we recommend plugging your devices into a power source Please enter Store ID Terms and Conditions Please acknowledge the terms and conditions below to continue. By downloading and using the ORU Content Transfer app, these terms will automatically apply to you. Please make sure therefore that you read them carefully before using the app. Please be aware that you cannot send it on to anyone else, and you\'re not allowed to copy, or modify the app, any part of the app, or our trademarks, in any way. You\'re not allowed to attempt to extract the source code of the app, you also shouldn\'t try to translate the app or make derivative versions. The app itself, and all the trademarks, copyright, database rights and intellectual property rights related to it, still belong to ORU Content Transfer. Terms & Conditions Privacy Statement Welcome to ORU Content Transfer ORU Content Transfer lets you transfer data from your old device to a new device. During use, this app needs the following permissions to provide data transfer services.

Call logs
Used to transfer call history

Contacts
Used to transfer contacts

Calendar
Used to transfer calendar data

SMS
Used to transfer SMS data

Storage
Used to transfer images, media and files

Settings
Used to transfer Settings

Camera
Used for reading QR Code

Location
Used for obtaining device’s location

Device information such as IMEI, device model, system language, OS Version, screen resolution, and ROM version are also collected.

You can exit this app to stop the information collected and upload activities described above.

By tapping I AGREE, you acknowledge and agree to the above content

ORU Content Transfer PRIVACY POLICY

ORU Inc., creator of ORU Content Transfer, recognizes that your privacy is important and that your personal information must be protected. This privacy policy describes the information that we collect from you, how we use it and what we do to protect it.

Please read through this policy carefully and periodically. Please contact us at support@ORU.com if you have any questions about the contents of this policy.

The information we collect is necessary for providing our services.

We do not collect any information from or about you that does not have to do with the services provided by our application. Any information that we collect from you is stored as only being connected to your account unless it is otherwise noted on the application. We take your privacy seriously and will only use and disclose information if they align with the terms outlined below.

We do not collect personal information.

Under no circumstances do we collect and store personal information from or about you. Personal information is any information that identifies you or another person, such as your first and last name, physical addresses, email addresses, telephone numbers, fax numbers, or any information that is specific to you that is stored within your device. Our data transfer feature only stores data from your old device onto the new device that you are transferring the information over to. Throughout the entire process, the ORU Content Transfer server is not accessed so that we do not see your personal information. In other words, you can be assured that there is no way for us to collect your information if you use our application to copy the data from one phone to another.

We only collect non-personal information.

In order to ensure that your experience while using our applications is comfortable, we collect non-personal information to better understand user behavior, discover problems with the applications, and improve our products. Non-personal information is data that does not permit direct association with any specific individual. Examples of non-personal information are: device ID, phone IMEI number, phone model, rom, phone operator, location, operation system, transfer logs, etc.

Permissions required by our applications all have a valid reason.

Our application requests for some access permissions that are deemed as access to sensitive and dangerous data on Android devices. You can find detailed explanations for why we request each permission in the Appendix section of this policy.

The permissions requested for our applications are:

Take pictures and videos (CAMERA)

Read your contacts (READ_CONTACTS)

Modify your contacts (WRITE_CONTACTS)

Read call log (READ_CALL_LOG)

Write call log (WRITE_CALL_LOG)

Read calendar (READ_CALENDAR)

Write calendar (WRITE_CALENDAR)

Read your text messages (READ_SMS)

Read the contents of your storage (READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE)

Modify or delete the contents of your storage (WRITE_ EXTERNAL_STORAGE)

Write Settings (WRITE_SETTINGS)

Security is important to us.

ORU Content Transfer is very concerned about safeguarding the confidentiality of your information. As stated before, we do not collect personal information. In order to protect the non-personal information, we collect from unauthorized access and use, we employ administrative, physical and electronic measures. ORU Content Transfer is well-equipped to handle personal or sensitive user data securely, including transmitting the data to backend server using modern cryptography over HTTPS.

Please be aware that the security measures that we take to protect your information are not absolutely guaranteed to counter unauthorized access or use of your Non-Personal Information.

Children

We do not provide service focus on Children. If you are under 13, please ask permission from your parent or guardian before using our application. Parental supervision is advised.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or comments about this Policy or our privacy practices, or to report any violations of the Policy or abuse of the Services or the Site, please contact us at support@ORU.com

We will update this privacy policy to ensure your rights.

To be ensure the quality of your experience and your security, we will be updating our privacy policy as needed. Any changes made to this policy will not reduce your rights in anyway. If the changes to this policy are significant, a notification will be shown on the application. However, smaller changes may be made so please review this policy periodically. If you do not agree to any changes to this policy, you should immediately stop using any of the services we provide and contact us. Your continued use of our services after changes to this Policy have been made mean that you have accepted the terms of the revised Policy. Please note that none of our employees or agents has the authority to violate any of the rights that have been laid out in this policy.

Appendix

Privacy-relevant Android permissions requested by our application CAMERA

Used for permissions that are associated with accessing camera or capturing images and/or videos from the device.

This permission allows this application to support the following feature related to phone camera:

1) Scan QR Code for establishing a wireless connection between two devices faster because this method can bypass the manual input of wireless password.

READ_CONTACTS

Used for permissions that allow an application to read the user’s contacts data. This permission allows the application to transfer telephone contacts as part of the Contacts transfer feature. The purpose is to retrieve the user’s contacts (e.g. phone number, contact name, email, etc) from an old phone and transfer over to and save on a new phone.

WRITE_CONTACTS

Used for permissions that allow an application to write the user’s contacts data. This permission allows the application to transfer telephone contacts as part of the Contacts transfer feature. The purpose is to write user’s contacts (e.g. phone number, contact name, email, etc), that are received from an old phone to the designated contacts storage on a new phone.

READ_CALL_LOG

Used for permissions that allow an application to read the user\'s call log.

This permission allows the application to transfer telephone call log as part of the Phone Replicate feature. The purpose is to retrieve user\'s call log from an old phone and transfer over to and save on a new phone.

WRITE_CALL_LOG

Used for permissions that allow an application to write (but not read) the user\'s call log data. This permission allows the application to transfer telephone call log as part of the Phone Replicate feature. The purpose is to write user’s call log (e.g. phone number, contact name, calling time, etc), that are received from an old phone, to the designated call log storage on a new phone.

READ_CALENDARS

Used for permissions that allow an application to read the user\'s calendar. This permission allows the application to transfer calendar as part of the calendar transfer feature. The purpose is to retrieve user’s calendar from an old phone and transfer over to and save on a new phone.

WRITE_CALENDARS

Used for permissions that allow an application to write (but not read) the user\'s calendar data. This permission allows the application to transfer telephone call log as part of the calendar transfer feature. The purpose is to write user’s calendar, that is retrieved from an old phone, to the designated calendar storage on a new phone.

READ_SMS

Used for permissions that allow an application to read SMS messages. This permission allows the application to transfer SMS messages as part of the Phone Replicate feature. The purpose is to retrieve user’s SMS messages from an old phone and transfer over to and save on a new phone.

READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE

Used for permissions that allow an application to read from external storage. This permission allows the application to access any files on the external storage, e.g. SD card, as part of ORU Content Transfer\'s core feature of transferring files. The user can select files to be transferred and send over the wireless connection created by the application.

WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE

Used for permissions that allow an application to write to external storage. This permission allows the application to access the external storage, e.g. SD card, as part of ORU Content Transfer’s core feature of transferring files. The user can choose to save received files that are transferred over the wireless connection into internal storage or external storage. The user must select to save to external storage from in-app settings.

WRITE_SETTINGS

Used for permissions that allow the app to copy Settings. The purpose is to copy user settings, which are retrieved from an old phone, to the Designated Settings on a new phone.

We need you to agree that Telefónica UK Ltd does not accept any liability for any loss of personal data including, but not limited to Contacts, SMS Content, Account Settings, Multi-media, Photographs & Videos or application / social media settings and or passwords, neither do we accept any liability for any damage caused to the device. Telefónica UK Ltd will also gather anonymous data about your appointment and device for the purpose of improving the service, this will include technical information about health checks and diagnostics, this can include the IMEI of the devices we work on. By signing this document, you give Telefónica UK Ltd permission to share core data and install third party applications on to your device for the purpose of diagnostics, health checks and data transfers, as approved by Telefónica UK Ltd, here necessary. We will not store any personal data on our workstations.\nPlease read our Privacy Statement and Content Policy. You will see IMEI popup. \nPlease wait for the countdown \ntimer to appear You have not entered the secret code *#06#. You can reprocess the IMEI by clicking on Start button. Please enable \"Display over other apps\" permission to continue diagnostics. Please enable below permissions to continue diagnostics \n\n 1. Display pop-up windows while running in the background \n 2. Display pop-up windows Capture IMEI Capturing IMEI
Please capture the device IMEI by following the steps below:

1. Touch the Start button to open the phone dialer.
2. Enter the code *#06#.
3. Take a screenshot of IMEI by holding down Power button and Volume Down key at the same time.
4. Hold them down until you hear an audible click or a screenshot sound.
5. Tap OK on the IMEI popup.
6. Press the Back Key.
7. Continue with the Wireless Content Transfer. Start IMEI was captured successfully. IMEI capture was unsuccessfull. \nTap OK to try again.
